noun.description: A liquid dish, typically made by boiling meat, fish, or vegetables, etc., in stock or water.
A substance or mixture perceived to resemble soup in appearance or consistency.
examples: the waves and the water beyond have become a thick brown soup

noun.description: Nitroglycerine or gelignite, especially as used for safecracking.

verb.description: Increase the power and efficiency of an engine or other machine.
examples: a souped-up Ford with big rear wheels

phrases: I know all about that game from soup to nuts
Yesterday, you got to hear discussions of everything from soup to nuts.
By understanding the process from soup to nuts you can be much more effective in solving user problems and developing a product that delights.
And what that means is that that organization has an ability from soup to nuts, top to bottom, to conduct independent operations.
It may be time for another bottom up review - another holistic review of defense policy from soup to nuts - that assesses the threat and what it will take to fight it.
origin: Middle English: from Old French soupe sop, broth (poured on slices of bread), from late Latin suppa, of Germanic origin.
